intro: Lotus corniculatus f. hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy horned vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of the genus Lotus. It is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. This species is notable for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it valuable in ecological restoration and as a forage crop.
